main event: A red and green balloon-shaped object descended upon the Stockton Naval Supply Depot, exploded upon contact with the ground, and left behind residue on January 5, 1951.
interesting points: The object was described as having red and green colors,An analysis of the residue indicated the object might have been a hot air balloon,The object exploded on impact,The investigation suggested the possibility of sabotage or oriental construction,No other significant evidence of the balloon was forwarded to the investigation.
witness description: civilian accounts, no specific witnesses listed
